content_1: At least 24,000 birds in nine sub-districts of Luwu Timur in South Sulawesi province were infected by H5N1 bird flu. Testing was done by rapid test and confirmed by laboratory examination at the Veterinary Disease Investigation Center laboratory in Maros. The regional government has instituted control measures, such as burning dead chickens and activating bird flu control points in each sub-district. The outbreak was reported on September 21. So far there have been no human cases associated with the outbreak.
